text: his room. The door was slammed shut with the stick, then, finally, all
title: Metamorphosis

text: was quiet.
title: Metamorphosis

text: II
title: Metamorphosis

text: It was not until it was getting dark that evening that Gregor awoke
title: Metamorphosis

text: from his deep and coma-like sleep. He would have woken soon afterwards
title: Metamorphosis

text: anyway even if he hadn’t been disturbed, as he had had enough sleep and
title: Metamorphosis

text: felt fully rested. But he had the impression that some hurried steps
title: Metamorphosis

text: and the sound of the door leading into the front room being carefully
title: Metamorphosis

text: shut had woken him. The light from the electric street lamps shone
title: Metamorphosis

text: palely here and there onto the ceiling and tops of the furniture, but
title: Metamorphosis

text: down below, where Gregor was, it was dark. He pushed himself over to
title: Metamorphosis

text: the door, feeling his way clumsily with his antennae—of which he was
title: Metamorphosis

text: now beginning to learn the value—in order to see what had been
title: Metamorphosis

text: happening there. The whole of his left side seemed like one, painfully
title: Metamorphosis

text: stretched scar, and he limped badly on his two rows of legs. One of the
title: Metamorphosis

text: legs had been badly injured in the events of that morning—it was nearly
title: Metamorphosis

text: a miracle that only one of them had been—and dragged along lifelessly.
title: Metamorphosis

text: It was only when he had reached the door that he realised what it
title: Metamorphosis

text: actually was that had drawn him over to it; it was the smell of
title: Metamorphosis

text: something to eat. By the door there was a dish filled with sweetened
title: Metamorphosis

text: milk with little pieces of white bread floating in it. He was so
title: Metamorphosis

text: pleased he almost laughed, as he was even hungrier than he had been
title: Metamorphosis

text: that morning, and immediately dipped his head into the milk, nearly
title: Metamorphosis

text: covering his eyes with it. But he soon drew his head back again in
title: Metamorphosis

text: disappointment; not only did the pain in his tender left side make it
title: Metamorphosis

text: difficult to eat the food—he was only able to eat if his whole body
title: Metamorphosis

text: worked together as a snuffling whole—but the milk did not taste at all
title: Metamorphosis

text: nice. Milk like this was normally his favourite drink, and his sister
title: Metamorphosis

text: had certainly left it there for him because of that, but he turned,
title: Metamorphosis

text: almost against his own will, away from the dish and crawled back into
title: Metamorphosis

text: the centre of the room.
title: Metamorphosis

text: Through the crack in the door, Gregor could see that the gas had been
title: Metamorphosis

text: lit in the living room. His father at this time would normally be sat
title: Metamorphosis

text: with his evening paper, reading it out in a loud voice to Gregor’s
title: Metamorphosis

text: mother, and sometimes to his sister, but there was now not a sound to
title: Metamorphosis

text: be heard. Gregor’s sister would often write and tell him about this
title: Metamorphosis

text: reading, but maybe his father had lost the habit in recent times. It
title: Metamorphosis

text: was so quiet all around too, even though there must have been somebody
title: Metamorphosis

text: in the flat. “What a quiet life it is the family lead”, said Gregor to
title: Metamorphosis

text: himself, and, gazing into the darkness, felt a great pride that he was
title: Metamorphosis

text: able to provide a life like that in such a nice home for his sister and
title: Metamorphosis

text: parents. But what now, if all this peace and wealth and comfort should
title: Metamorphosis

text: come to a horrible and frightening end? That was something that Gregor
title: Metamorphosis

text: did not want to think about too much, so he started to move about,
title: Metamorphosis

text: crawling up and down the room.
title: Metamorphosis

text: Once during that long evening, the door on one side of the room was
title: Metamorphosis

text: opened very slightly and hurriedly closed again; later on the door on
title: Metamorphosis

text: the other side did the same; it seemed that someone needed to enter the
title: Metamorphosis

text: room but thought better of it. Gregor went and waited immediately by
title: Metamorphosis

text: the door, resolved either to bring the timorous visitor into the room
title: Metamorphosis

text: in some way or at least to find out who it was; but the door was opened
title: Metamorphosis

text: no more that night and Gregor waited in vain. The previous morning
title: Metamorphosis

text: while the doors were locked everyone had wanted to get in there to him,
title: Metamorphosis

text: but now, now that he had opened up one of the doors and the other had
title: Metamorphosis

text: clearly been unlocked some time during the day, no-one came, and the
title: Metamorphosis

text: keys were in the other sides.
title: Metamorphosis

text: It was not until late at night that the gaslight in the living room was
title: Metamorphosis

text: put out, and now it was easy to see that his parents and sister had
title: Metamorphosis

text: stayed awake all that time, as they all could be distinctly heard as
title: Metamorphosis

text: they went away together on tip-toe. It was clear that no-one would come
title: Metamorphosis

text: into Gregor’s room any more until morning; that gave him plenty of time
title: Metamorphosis

text: to think undisturbed about how he would have to re-arrange his life.
title: Metamorphosis

text: For some reason, the tall, empty room where he was forced to remain
title: Metamorphosis

text: made him feel uneasy as he lay there flat on the floor, even though he
title: Metamorphosis

text: had been living in it for five years. Hardly aware of what he was doing
title: Metamorphosis

text: other than a slight feeling of shame, he hurried under the couch. It
title: Metamorphosis

text: pressed down on his back a little, and he was no longer able to lift
title: Metamorphosis

text: his head, but he nonetheless felt immediately at ease and his only
title: Metamorphosis

text: regret was that his body was too broad to get it all underneath.
title: Metamorphosis

text: He spent the whole night there. Some of the time he passed in a light
title: Metamorphosis

text: sleep, although he frequently woke from it in alarm because of his
title: Metamorphosis

text: hunger, and some of the time was spent in worries and vague hopes
title: Metamorphosis

text: which, however, always led to the same conclusion: for the time being
title: Metamorphosis

text: he must remain calm, he must show patience and the greatest
title: Metamorphosis

text: consideration so that his family could bear the unpleasantness that he,
title: Metamorphosis

text: in his present condition, was forced to impose on them.
title: Metamorphosis

text: Gregor soon had the opportunity to test the strength of his decisions,
title: Metamorphosis

text: as early the next morning, almost before the night had ended, his
title: Metamorphosis

text: sister, nearly fully dressed, opened the door from the front room and
title: Metamorphosis

text: looked anxiously in. She did not see him straight away, but when she
title: Metamorphosis

text: did notice him under the couch—he had to be somewhere, for God’s sake,
title: Metamorphosis

text: he couldn’t have flown away—she was so shocked that she lost control of
title: Metamorphosis

text: herself and slammed the door shut again from outside. But she seemed to
title: Metamorphosis

text: regret her behaviour, as she opened the door again straight away and
title: Metamorphosis

text: came in on tip-toe as if entering the room of someone seriously ill or
title: Metamorphosis

text: even of a stranger. Gregor had pushed his head forward, right to the
title: Metamorphosis

text: edge of the couch, and watched her. Would she notice that he had left
title: Metamorphosis

text: the milk as it was, realise that it was not from any lack of hunger and
title: Metamorphosis

text: bring him in some other food that was more suitable? If she didn’t do
title: Metamorphosis

text: it herself he would rather go hungry than draw her attention to it,
title: Metamorphosis

text: although he did feel a terrible urge to rush forward from under the
title: Metamorphosis

text: couch, throw himself at his sister’s feet and beg her for something
title: Metamorphosis

text: good to eat. However, his sister noticed the full dish immediately and
title: Metamorphosis

text: looked at it and the few drops of milk splashed around it with some
title: Metamorphosis

text: surprise. She immediately picked it up—using a rag, not her bare
title: Metamorphosis

text: hands—and carried it out. Gregor was extremely curious as to what she
title: Metamorphosis

text: would bring in its place, imagining the wildest possibilities, but he
title: Metamorphosis

text: never could have guessed what his sister, in her goodness, actually did
title: Metamorphosis

text: bring. In order to test his taste, she brought him a whole selection of
title: Metamorphosis

text: things, all spread out on an old newspaper. There were old, half-rotten
title: Metamorphosis

text: vegetables; bones from the evening meal, covered in white sauce that
title: Metamorphosis

text: had gone hard; a few raisins and almonds; some cheese that Gregor had
title: Metamorphosis

text: declared inedible two days before; a dry roll and some bread spread
title: Metamorphosis

text: with butter and salt. As well as all that she had poured some water
title: Metamorphosis

text: into the dish, which had probably been permanently set aside for
title: Metamorphosis

text: Gregor’s use, and placed it beside them. Then, out of consideration for
title: Metamorphosis

text: Gregor’s feelings, as she knew that he would not eat in front of her,
title: Metamorphosis

text: she hurried out again and even turned the key in the lock so that
title: Metamorphosis

text: Gregor would know he could make things as comfortable for himself as he
title: Metamorphosis

text: liked. Gregor’s little legs whirred, at last he could eat. What’s more,
title: Metamorphosis

text: his injuries must already have completely healed as he found no
title: Metamorphosis

text: difficulty in moving. This amazed him, as more than a month earlier he
title: Metamorphosis

text: had cut his finger slightly with a knife, he thought of how his finger
title: Metamorphosis

text: had still hurt the day before yesterday. “Am I less sensitive than I
title: Metamorphosis

text: used to be, then?”, he thought, and was already sucking greedily at the
title: Metamorphosis

text: cheese which had immediately, almost compellingly, attracted him much
title: Metamorphosis

text: more than the other foods on the newspaper. Quickly one after another,
title: Metamorphosis

text: his eyes watering with pleasure, he consumed the cheese, the vegetables
title: Metamorphosis

text: and the sauce; the fresh foods, on the other hand, he didn’t like at
title: Metamorphosis

text: all, and even dragged the things he did want to eat a little way away
title: Metamorphosis

text: from them because he couldn’t stand the smell. Long after he had
title: Metamorphosis

text: finished eating and lay lethargic in the same place, his sister slowly
title: Metamorphosis

text: turned the key in the lock as a sign to him that he should withdraw. He
title: Metamorphosis

text: was immediately startled, although he had been half asleep, and he
title: Metamorphosis

text: hurried back under the couch. But he needed great self-control to stay
title: Metamorphosis

text: there even for the short time that his sister was in the room, as
title: Metamorphosis

text: eating so much food had rounded out his body a little and he could
title: Metamorphosis

text: hardly breathe in that narrow space. Half suffocating, he watched with
title: Metamorphosis

text: bulging eyes as his sister unselfconsciously took a broom and swept up
title: Metamorphosis

text: the left-overs, mixing them in with the food he had not even touched at
title: Metamorphosis

text: all as if it could not be used any more. She quickly dropped it all
title: Metamorphosis

text: into a bin, closed it with its wooden lid, and carried everything out.
title: Metamorphosis

text: She had hardly turned her back before Gregor came out again from under
title: Metamorphosis

text: the couch and stretched himself.
title: Metamorphosis

text: This was how Gregor received his food each day now, once in the morning
title: Metamorphosis

text: while his parents and the maid were still asleep, and the second time
title: Metamorphosis

text: after everyone had eaten their meal at midday as his parents would
title: Metamorphosis

text: sleep for a little while then as well, and Gregor’s sister would send
title: Metamorphosis

text: the maid away on some errand. Gregor’s father and mother certainly did
title: Metamorphosis

text: not want him to starve either, but perhaps it would have been more than
title: Metamorphosis

text: they could stand to have any more experience of his feeding than being
title: Metamorphosis

text: told about it, and perhaps his sister wanted to spare them what
title: Metamorphosis

text: distress she could as they were indeed suffering enough.
title: Metamorphosis

text: It was impossible for Gregor to find out what they had told the doctor
title: Metamorphosis

text: and the locksmith that first morning to get them out of the flat. As
title: Metamorphosis

text: nobody could understand him, nobody, not even his sister, thought that
title: Metamorphosis

text: he could understand them, so he had to be content to hear his sister’s
title: Metamorphosis

text: sighs and appeals to the saints as she moved about his room. It was
title: Metamorphosis

text: only later, when she had become a little more used to everything—there
title: Metamorphosis

text: was, of course, no question of her ever becoming fully used to the
title: Metamorphosis

text: situation—that Gregor would sometimes catch a friendly comment, or at
title: Metamorphosis

text: least a comment that could be construed as friendly. “He’s enjoyed his
title: Metamorphosis

text: dinner today”, she might say when he had diligently cleared away all
title: Metamorphosis

text: the food left for him, or if he left most of it, which slowly became
title: Metamorphosis

text: more and more frequent, she would often say, sadly, “now everything’s
title: Metamorphosis

text: just been left there again”.
title: Metamorphosis

text: Although Gregor wasn’t able to hear any news directly he did listen to
title: Metamorphosis

text: much of what was said in the next rooms, and whenever he heard anyone
title: Metamorphosis

text: speaking he would scurry straight to the appropriate door and press his
title: Metamorphosis

text: whole body against it. There was seldom any conversation, especially at
title: Metamorphosis

text: first, that was not about him in some way, even if only in secret. For
title: Metamorphosis

text: two whole days, all the talk at every mealtime was about what they
title: Metamorphosis

text: should do now; but even between meals they spoke about the same subject
title: Metamorphosis

text: as there were always at least two members of the family at home—nobody
title: Metamorphosis

text: wanted to be at home by themselves and it was out of the question to
title: Metamorphosis

text: leave the flat entirely empty. And on the very first day the maid had
title: Metamorphosis

text: fallen to her knees and begged Gregor’s mother to let her go without
title: Metamorphosis

text: delay. It was not very clear how much she knew of what had happened but
title: Metamorphosis

text: she left within a quarter of an hour, tearfully thanking Gregor’s
title: Metamorphosis

text: mother for her dismissal as if she had done her an enormous service.
title: Metamorphosis

text: She even swore emphatically not to tell anyone the slightest about what
title: Metamorphosis

text: had happened, even though no-one had asked that of her.
title: Metamorphosis

text: Now Gregor’s sister also had to help his mother with the cooking;
title: Metamorphosis

text: although that was not so much bother as no-one ate very much. Gregor
title: Metamorphosis

text: often heard how one of them would unsuccessfully urge another to eat,
title: Metamorphosis

text: and receive no more answer than “no thanks, I’ve had enough” or
title: Metamorphosis

text: something similar. No-one drank very much either. His sister would
title: Metamorphosis

text: sometimes ask his father whether he would like a beer, hoping for the
title: Metamorphosis

text: chance to go and fetch it herself. When his father then said nothing
title: Metamorphosis

text: she would add, so that he would not feel selfish, that she could send
title: Metamorphosis

text: the housekeeper for it, but then his father would close the matter with
title: Metamorphosis

text: a big, loud “No”, and no more would be said.
title: Metamorphosis

text: Even before the first day had come to an end, his father had explained
title: Metamorphosis

text: to Gregor’s mother and sister what their finances and prospects were.
title: Metamorphosis

text: Now and then he stood up from the table and took some receipt or
title: Metamorphosis

text: document from the little cash box he had saved from his business when
title: Metamorphosis

text: it had collapsed five years earlier. Gregor heard how he opened the
title: Metamorphosis

text: complicated lock and then closed it again after he had taken the item
title: Metamorphosis

text: he wanted. What he heard his father say was some of the first good news
title: Metamorphosis

text: that Gregor heard since he had first been incarcerated in his room. He
title: Metamorphosis

text: had thought that nothing at all remained from his father’s business, at
title: Metamorphosis

text: least he had never told him anything different, and Gregor had never
title: Metamorphosis

text: asked him about it anyway. Their business misfortune had reduced the
title: Metamorphosis

text: family to a state of total despair, and Gregor’s only concern at that
title: Metamorphosis

text: time had been to arrange things so that they could all forget about it
title: Metamorphosis

text: as quickly as possible. So then he started working especially hard,
title: Metamorphosis

text: with a fiery vigour that raised him from a junior salesman to a
title: Metamorphosis

text: travelling representative almost overnight, bringing with it the chance
title: Metamorphosis

text: to earn money in quite different ways. Gregor converted his success at
title: Metamorphosis

text: work straight into cash that he could lay on the table at home for the
title: Metamorphosis

text: benefit of his astonished and delighted family. They had been good
title: Metamorphosis

text: times and they had never come again, at least not with the same
title: Metamorphosis

text: splendour, even though Gregor had later earned so much that he was in a
title: Metamorphosis

text: position to bear the costs of the whole family, and did bear them. They
title: Metamorphosis

text: had even got used to it, both Gregor and the family, they took the
title: Metamorphosis

text: money with gratitude and he was glad to provide it, although there was
title: Metamorphosis

text: no longer much warm affection given in return. Gregor only remained
title: Metamorphosis

text: close to his sister now. Unlike him, she was very fond of music and a
title: Metamorphosis

text: gifted and expressive violinist, it was his secret plan to send her to
title: Metamorphosis

text: the conservatory next year even though it would cause great expense
title: Metamorphosis

text: that would have to be made up for in some other way. During Gregor’s
title: Metamorphosis

text: short periods in town, conversation with his sister would often turn to
title: Metamorphosis

text: the conservatory but it was only ever mentioned as a lovely dream that
title: Metamorphosis

text: could never be realised. Their parents did not like to hear this
title: Metamorphosis

text: innocent talk, but Gregor thought about it quite hard and decided he
title: Metamorphosis

text: would let them know what he planned with a grand announcement of it on
title: Metamorphosis

text: Christmas day.
title: Metamorphosis

text: That was the sort of totally pointless thing that went through his mind
title: Metamorphosis

text: in his present state, pressed upright against the door and listening.
title: Metamorphosis

text: There were times when he simply became too tired to continue listening,
title: Metamorphosis

text: when his head would fall wearily against the door and he would pull it
title: Metamorphosis

text: up again with a start, as even the slightest noise he caused would be
title: Metamorphosis

text: heard next door and they would all go silent. “What’s that he’s doing
title: Metamorphosis

text: now”, his father would say after a while, clearly having gone over to
title: Metamorphosis

text: the door, and only then would the interrupted conversation slowly be
title: Metamorphosis

text: taken up again.
title: Metamorphosis

text: When explaining things, his father repeated himself several times,
title: Metamorphosis

text: partly because it was a long time since he had been occupied with these
title: Metamorphosis

text: matters himself and partly because Gregor’s mother did not understand
title: Metamorphosis

text: everything the first time. From these repeated explanations Gregor
title: Metamorphosis

text: learned, to his pleasure, that despite all their misfortunes there was
title: Metamorphosis

text: still some money available from the old days. It was not a lot, but it
title: Metamorphosis

text: had not been touched in the meantime and some interest had accumulated.
title: Metamorphosis

text: Besides that, they had not been using up all the money that Gregor had
title: Metamorphosis

text: been bringing home every month, keeping only a little for himself, so
title: Metamorphosis

text: that that, too, had been accumulating. Behind the door, Gregor nodded
title: Metamorphosis

text: with enthusiasm in his pleasure at this unexpected thrift and caution.
title: Metamorphosis

text: He could actually have used this surplus money to reduce his father’s
title: Metamorphosis

text: debt to his boss, and the day when he could have freed himself from
title: Metamorphosis

text: that job would have come much closer, but now it was certainly better
title: Metamorphosis

text: the way his father had done things.
title: Metamorphosis

text: This money, however, was certainly not enough to enable the family to
title: Metamorphosis

text: live off the interest; it was enough to maintain them for, perhaps, one
title: Metamorphosis

text: or two years, no more. That’s to say, it was money that should not
title: Metamorphosis

text: really be touched but set aside for emergencies; money to live on had
title: Metamorphosis

text: to be earned. His father was healthy but old, and lacking in self
title: Metamorphosis

text: confidence. During the five years that he had not been working—the
title: Metamorphosis

text: first holiday in a life that had been full of strain and no success—he
title: Metamorphosis

text: had put on a lot of weight and become very slow and clumsy. Would
title: Metamorphosis

text: Gregor’s elderly mother now have to go and earn money? She suffered
title: Metamorphosis

text: from asthma and it was a strain for her just to move about the home,
title: Metamorphosis

text: every other day would be spent struggling for breath on the sofa by the
title: Metamorphosis

text: open window. Would his sister have to go and earn money? She was still
title: Metamorphosis

text: a child of seventeen, her life up till then had been very enviable,
title: Metamorphosis

text: consisting of wearing nice clothes, sleeping late, helping out in the
title: Metamorphosis

text: business, joining in with a few modest pleasures and most of all
title: Metamorphosis

text: playing the violin. Whenever they began to talk of the need to earn
title: Metamorphosis

text: money, Gregor would always first let go of the door and then throw
title: Metamorphosis

text: himself onto the cool, leather sofa next to it, as he became quite hot
title: Metamorphosis

text: with shame and regret.
title: Metamorphosis

text: He would often lie there the whole night through, not sleeping a wink
title: Metamorphosis

text: but scratching at the leather for hours on end. Or he might go to all
title: Metamorphosis

text: the effort of pushing a chair to the window, climbing up onto the sill
title: Metamorphosis

text: and, propped up in the chair, leaning on the window to stare out of it.
title: Metamorphosis

text: He had used to feel a great sense of freedom from doing this, but doing
title: Metamorphosis

text: it now was obviously something more remembered than experienced, as
title: Metamorphosis

text: what he actually saw in this way was becoming less distinct every day,
title: Metamorphosis

text: even things that were quite near; he had used to curse the ever-present
title: Metamorphosis

text: view of the hospital across the street, but now he could not see it at
title: Metamorphosis

text: all, and if he had not known that he lived in Charlottenstrasse, which
title: Metamorphosis

text: was a quiet street despite being in the middle of the city, he could
title: Metamorphosis

text: have thought that he was looking out the window at a barren waste where
title: Metamorphosis

text: the grey sky and the grey earth mingled inseparably. His observant
title: Metamorphosis

text: sister only needed to notice the chair twice before she would always
title: Metamorphosis

text: push it back to its exact position by the window after she had tidied
title: Metamorphosis

text: up the room, and even left the inner pane of the window open from then
title: Metamorphosis

text: on.
title: Metamorphosis

text: If Gregor had only been able to speak to his sister and thank her for
title: Metamorphosis

text: all that she had to do for him it would have been easier for him to
title: Metamorphosis

text: bear it; but as it was it caused him pain. His sister, naturally, tried
title: Metamorphosis

text: as far as possible to pretend there was nothing burdensome about it,
title: Metamorphosis

text: and the longer it went on, of course, the better she was able to do so,
title: Metamorphosis

text: but as time went by Gregor was also able to see through it all so much
title: Metamorphosis

text: better. It had even become very unpleasant for him, now, whenever she
title: Metamorphosis

text: entered the room. No sooner had she come in than she would quickly
title: Metamorphosis

text: close the door as a precaution so that no-one would have to suffer the
title: Metamorphosis

text: view into Gregor’s room, then she would go straight to the window and
title: Metamorphosis

text: pull it hurriedly open almost as if she were suffocating. Even if it
title: Metamorphosis

text: was cold, she would stay at the window breathing deeply for a little
title: Metamorphosis

text: while. She would alarm Gregor twice a day with this running about and
title: Metamorphosis

text: noise making; he would stay under the couch shivering the whole while,
title: Metamorphosis

text: knowing full well that she would certainly have liked to spare him this
title: Metamorphosis

text: ordeal, but it was impossible for her to be in the same room with him
title: Metamorphosis

text: with the windows closed.
title: Metamorphosis

text: One day, about a month after Gregor’s transformation when his sister no
title: Metamorphosis

text: longer had any particular reason to be shocked at his appearance, she
title: Metamorphosis

text: came into the room a little earlier than usual and found him still
title: Metamorphosis

text: staring out the window, motionless, and just where he would be most
title: Metamorphosis

text: horrible. In itself, his sister’s not coming into the room would have
title: Metamorphosis

text: been no surprise for Gregor as it would have been difficult for her to
title: Metamorphosis

text: immediately open the window while he was still there, but not only did
title: Metamorphosis

text: she not come in, she went straight back and closed the door behind her,
title: Metamorphosis

text: a stranger would have thought he had threatened her and tried to bite
title: Metamorphosis

text: her. Gregor went straight to hide himself under the couch, of course,
title: Metamorphosis

text: but he had to wait until midday before his sister came back and she
title: Metamorphosis

text: seemed much more uneasy than usual. It made him realise that she still
title: Metamorphosis

text: found his appearance unbearable and would continue to do so, she
title: Metamorphosis

text: probably even had to overcome the urge to flee when she saw the little
title: Metamorphosis

text: bit of him that protruded from under the couch. One day, in order to
title: Metamorphosis

text: spare her even this sight, he spent four hours carrying the bedsheet
title: Metamorphosis

text: over to the couch on his back and arranged it so that he was completely
title: Metamorphosis

text: covered and his sister would not be able to see him even if she bent
title: Metamorphosis

text: down. If she did not think this sheet was necessary then all she had to
title: Metamorphosis

text: do was take it off again, as it was clear enough that it was no
title: Metamorphosis

text: pleasure for Gregor to cut himself off so completely. She left the
title: Metamorphosis

text: sheet where it was. Gregor even thought he glimpsed a look of gratitude
title: Metamorphosis

text: one time when he carefully looked out from under the sheet to see how
title: Metamorphosis

text: his sister liked the new arrangement.
title: Metamorphosis

text: For the first fourteen days, Gregor’s parents could not bring
title: Metamorphosis

text: themselves to come into the room to see him. He would often hear them
title: Metamorphosis

text: say how they appreciated all the new work his sister was doing even
title: Metamorphosis

text: though, before, they had seen her as a girl who was somewhat useless
title: Metamorphosis

text: and frequently been annoyed with her. But now the two of them, father
title: Metamorphosis

text: and mother, would often both wait outside the door of Gregor’s room
title: Metamorphosis

text: while his sister tidied up in there, and as soon as she went out again
title: Metamorphosis

text: she would have to tell them exactly how everything looked, what Gregor
title: Metamorphosis

text: had eaten, how he had behaved this time and whether, perhaps, any
title: Metamorphosis

text: slight improvement could be seen. His mother also wanted to go in and
title: Metamorphosis

text: visit Gregor relatively soon but his father and sister at first
title: Metamorphosis

text: persuaded her against it. Gregor listened very closely to all this, and
title: Metamorphosis

text: approved fully. Later, though, she had to be held back by force, which
title: Metamorphosis

text: made her call out: “Let me go and see Gregor, he is my unfortunate son!
title: Metamorphosis

text: Can’t you understand I have to see him?”, and Gregor would think to
title: Metamorphosis

text: himself that maybe it would be better if his mother came in, not every
title: Metamorphosis

text: day of course, but one day a week, perhaps; she could understand
title: Metamorphosis

text: everything much better than his sister who, for all her courage, was
title: Metamorphosis

text: still just a child after all, and really might not have had an adult’s
title: Metamorphosis

text: appreciation of the burdensome job she had taken on.
title: Metamorphosis

text: Gregor’s wish to see his mother was soon realised. Out of consideration
title: Metamorphosis

text: for his parents, Gregor wanted to avoid being seen at the window during
title: Metamorphosis

text: the day, the few square meters of the floor did not give him much room
title: Metamorphosis

text: to crawl about, it was hard to just lie quietly through the night, his
title: Metamorphosis

text: food soon stopped giving him any pleasure at all, and so, to entertain
title: Metamorphosis

text: himself, he got into the habit of crawling up and down the walls and
title: Metamorphosis

text: ceiling. He was especially fond of hanging from the ceiling; it was
title: Metamorphosis

text: quite different from lying on the floor; he could breathe more freely;
title: Metamorphosis

text: his body had a light swing to it; and up there, relaxed and almost
title: Metamorphosis

text: happy, it might happen that he would surprise even himself by letting
title: Metamorphosis

text: go of the ceiling and landing on the floor with a crash. But now, of
title: Metamorphosis

text: course, he had far better control of his body than before and, even
title: Metamorphosis

text: with a fall as great as that, caused himself no damage. Very soon his
title: Metamorphosis

text: sister noticed Gregor’s new way of entertaining himself—he had, after
title: Metamorphosis

text: all, left traces of the adhesive from his feet as he crawled about—and
title: Metamorphosis

text: got it into her head to make it as easy as possible for him by removing
title: Metamorphosis

text: the furniture that got in his way, especially the chest of drawers and
title: Metamorphosis

text: the desk. Now, this was not something that she would be able to do by
title: Metamorphosis

text: herself; she did not dare to ask for help from her father; the sixteen
title: Metamorphosis

text: year old maid had carried on bravely since the cook had left but she
title: Metamorphosis

text: certainly would not have helped in this, she had even asked to be
title: Metamorphosis

text: allowed to keep the kitchen locked at all times and never to have to
title: Metamorphosis

text: open the door unless it was especially important; so his sister had no
title: Metamorphosis

text: choice but to choose some time when Gregor’s father was not there and
title: Metamorphosis

text: fetch his mother to help her. As she approached the room, Gregor could
title: Metamorphosis

text: hear his mother express her joy, but once at the door she went silent.
title: Metamorphosis

text: First, of course, his sister came in and looked round to see that
title: Metamorphosis

text: everything in the room was alright; and only then did she let her
title: Metamorphosis

text: mother enter. Gregor had hurriedly pulled the sheet down lower over the
title: Metamorphosis

text: couch and put more folds into it so that everything really looked as if
title: Metamorphosis

text: it had just been thrown down by chance. Gregor also refrained, this
title: Metamorphosis

text: time, from spying out from under the sheet; he gave up the chance to
title: Metamorphosis

text: see his mother until later and was simply glad that she had come. “You
title: Metamorphosis

text: can come in, he can’t be seen”, said his sister, obviously leading her
title: Metamorphosis

text: in by the hand. The old chest of drawers was too heavy for a pair of
title: Metamorphosis

text: feeble women to be heaving about, but Gregor listened as they pushed it
title: Metamorphosis

text: from its place, his sister always taking on the heaviest part of the
title: Metamorphosis

text: work for herself and ignoring her mother’s warnings that she would
title: Metamorphosis

text: strain herself. This lasted a very long time. After labouring at it for
title: Metamorphosis

text: fifteen minutes or more his mother said it would be better to leave the
title: Metamorphosis

text: chest where it was, for one thing it was too heavy for them to get the
title: Metamorphosis

text: job finished before Gregor’s father got home and leaving it in the
title: Metamorphosis

text: middle of the room it would be in his way even more, and for another
title: Metamorphosis

text: thing it wasn’t even sure that taking the furniture away would really
title: Metamorphosis

text: be any help to him. She thought just the opposite; the sight of the
title: Metamorphosis

text: bare walls saddened her right to her heart; and why wouldn’t Gregor
title: Metamorphosis

text: feel the same way about it, he’d been used to this furniture in his
title: Metamorphosis

text: room for a long time and it would make him feel abandoned to be in an
title: Metamorphosis

text: empty room like that. Then, quietly, almost whispering as if wanting
title: Metamorphosis

text: Gregor (whose whereabouts she did not know) to hear not even the tone
title: Metamorphosis

text: of her voice, as she was convinced that he did not understand her
title: Metamorphosis

text: words, she added “and by taking the furniture away, won’t it seem like
title: Metamorphosis

text: we’re showing that we’ve given up all hope of improvement and we’re
title: Metamorphosis

text: abandoning him to cope for himself? I think it’d be best to leave the
title: Metamorphosis

text: room exactly the way it was before so that when Gregor comes back to us
title: Metamorphosis

text: again he’ll find everything unchanged and he’ll be able to forget the
title: Metamorphosis

text: time in between all the easier”.
title: Metamorphosis

text: Hearing these words from his mother made Gregor realise that the lack
title: Metamorphosis

text: of any direct human communication, along with the monotonous life led
title: Metamorphosis

text: by the family during these two months, must have made him confused—he
title: Metamorphosis

text: could think of no other way of explaining to himself why he had
title: Metamorphosis

text: seriously wanted his room emptied out. Had he really wanted to
title: Metamorphosis

text: transform his room into a cave, a warm room fitted out with the nice
title: Metamorphosis

text: furniture he had inherited? That would have let him crawl around
title: Metamorphosis

text: unimpeded in any direction, but it would also have let him quickly
title: Metamorphosis

text: forget his past when he had still been human. He had come very close to
title: Metamorphosis

text: forgetting, and it had only been the voice of his mother, unheard for
title: Metamorphosis

text: so long, that had shaken him out of it. Nothing should be removed;
title: Metamorphosis

text: everything had to stay; he could not do without the good influence the
title: Metamorphosis

text: furniture had on his condition; and if the furniture made it difficult
title: Metamorphosis

text: for him to crawl about mindlessly that was not a loss but a great
title: Metamorphosis

text: advantage.
title: Metamorphosis

text: His sister, unfortunately, did not agree; she had become used to the
title: Metamorphosis

text: idea, not without reason, that she was Gregor’s spokesman to his
title: Metamorphosis

text: parents about the things that concerned him. This meant that his
title: Metamorphosis

text: mother’s advice now was sufficient reason for her to insist on removing
title: Metamorphosis

text: not only the chest of drawers and the desk, as she had thought at
title: Metamorphosis

text: first, but all the furniture apart from the all-important couch. It was
title: Metamorphosis

text: more than childish perversity, of course, or the unexpected confidence
title: Metamorphosis

text: she had recently acquired, that made her insist; she had indeed noticed
title: Metamorphosis

text: that Gregor needed a lot of room to crawl about in, whereas the
title: Metamorphosis

text: furniture, as far as anyone could see, was of no use to him at all.
title: Metamorphosis

text: Girls of that age, though, do become enthusiastic about things and feel
title: Metamorphosis

text: they must get their way whenever they can. Perhaps this was what
title: Metamorphosis

text: tempted Grete to make Gregor’s situation seem even more shocking than
title: Metamorphosis

text: it was so that she could do even more for him. Grete would probably be
title: Metamorphosis

text: the only one who would dare enter a room dominated by Gregor crawling
title: Metamorphosis

text: about the bare walls by himself.
title: Metamorphosis

text: So she refused to let her mother dissuade her. Gregor’s mother already
title: Metamorphosis

text: looked uneasy in his room, she soon stopped speaking and helped
title: Metamorphosis

text: Gregor’s sister to get the chest of drawers out with what strength she
title: Metamorphosis

text: had. The chest of drawers was something that Gregor could do without if
title: Metamorphosis

text: he had to, but the writing desk had to stay. Hardly had the two women
title: Metamorphosis

text: pushed the chest of drawers, groaning, out of the room than Gregor
title: Metamorphosis

text: poked his head out from under the couch to see what he could do about
title: Metamorphosis

text: it. He meant to be as careful and considerate as he could, but,
title: Metamorphosis

text: unfortunately, it was his mother who came back first while Grete in the
title: Metamorphosis

text: next room had her arms round the chest, pushing and pulling at it from
title: Metamorphosis

text: side to side by herself without, of course, moving it an inch. His
title: Metamorphosis

text: mother was not used to the sight of Gregor, he might have made her ill,
title: Metamorphosis

text: so Gregor hurried backwards to the far end of the couch. In his
title: Metamorphosis

text: startlement, though, he was not able to prevent the sheet at its front
title: Metamorphosis

text: from moving a little. It was enough to attract his mother’s attention.
title: Metamorphosis

text: She stood very still, remained there a moment, and then went back out
title: Metamorphosis

text: to Grete.
title: Metamorphosis

text: Gregor kept trying to assure himself that nothing unusual was
title: Metamorphosis

text: happening, it was just a few pieces of furniture being moved after all,
title: Metamorphosis

text: but he soon had to admit that the women going to and fro, their little
title: Metamorphosis

text: calls to each other, the scraping of the furniture on the floor, all
title: Metamorphosis

text: these things made him feel as if he were being assailed from all sides.
title: Metamorphosis

text: With his head and legs pulled in against him and his body pressed to
title: Metamorphosis

text: the floor, he was forced to admit to himself that he could not stand
title: Metamorphosis

text: all of this much longer. They were emptying his room out; taking away
title: Metamorphosis

text: everything that was dear to him; they had already taken out the chest
title: Metamorphosis

text: containing his fretsaw and other tools; now they threatened to remove
title: Metamorphosis

text: the writing desk with its place clearly worn into the floor, the desk
title: Metamorphosis

text: where he had done his homework as a business trainee, at high school,
title: Metamorphosis

text: even while he had been at infant school—he really could not wait any
title: Metamorphosis

text: longer to see whether the two women’s intentions were good. He had
title: Metamorphosis

text: nearly forgotten they were there anyway, as they were now too tired to
title: Metamorphosis

text: say anything while they worked and he could only hear their feet as
title: Metamorphosis

text: they stepped heavily on the floor.
title: Metamorphosis

text: So, while the women were leant against the desk in the other room
title: Metamorphosis

text: catching their breath, he sallied out, changed direction four times not
title: Metamorphosis

text: knowing what he should save first before his attention was suddenly
title: Metamorphosis

text: caught by the picture on the wall—which was already denuded of
title: Metamorphosis

text: everything else that had been on it—of the lady dressed in copious fur.
title: Metamorphosis

text: He hurried up onto the picture and pressed himself against its glass,
title: Metamorphosis

text: it held him firmly and felt good on his hot belly. This picture at
title: Metamorphosis

text: least, now totally covered by Gregor, would certainly be taken away by
title: Metamorphosis

text: no-one. He turned his head to face the door into the living room so
title: Metamorphosis

text: that he could watch the women when they came back.
title: Metamorphosis

text: They had not allowed themselves a long rest and came back quite soon;
title: Metamorphosis

text: Grete had put her arm around her mother and was nearly carrying her.
title: Metamorphosis

text: “What shall we take now, then?”, said Grete and looked around. Her eyes
title: Metamorphosis

text: met those of Gregor on the wall. Perhaps only because her mother was
title: Metamorphosis

text: there, she remained calm, bent her face to her so that she would not
title: Metamorphosis

text: look round and said, albeit hurriedly and with a tremor in her voice:
title: Metamorphosis

text: “Come on, let’s go back in the living room for a while?” Gregor could
title: Metamorphosis

text: see what Grete had in mind, she wanted to take her mother somewhere
title: Metamorphosis

text: safe and then chase him down from the wall. Well, she could certainly
title: Metamorphosis

text: try it! He sat unyielding on his picture. He would rather jump at
title: Metamorphosis

text: Grete’s face.
title: Metamorphosis

text: But Grete’s words had made her mother quite worried, she stepped to one
title: Metamorphosis

text: side, saw the enormous brown patch against the flowers of the
title: Metamorphosis

text: wallpaper, and before she even realised it was Gregor that she saw
title: Metamorphosis

text: screamed: “Oh God, oh God!” Arms outstretched, she fell onto the couch
title: Metamorphosis

text: as if she had given up everything and stayed there immobile. “Gregor!”
title: Metamorphosis

text: shouted his sister, glowering at him and shaking her fist. That was the
title: Metamorphosis

text: first word she had spoken to him directly since his transformation. She
title: Metamorphosis

text: ran into the other room to fetch some kind of smelling salts to bring
title: Metamorphosis

text: her mother out of her faint; Gregor wanted to help too—he could save
title: Metamorphosis

text: his picture later, although he stuck fast to the glass and had to pull
title: Metamorphosis

text: himself off by force; then he, too, ran into the next room as if he
title: Metamorphosis

text: could advise his sister like in the old days; but he had to just stand
title: Metamorphosis

text: behind her doing nothing; she was looking into various bottles, he
title: Metamorphosis

text: startled her when she turned round; a bottle fell to the ground and
title: Metamorphosis

text: broke; a splinter cut Gregor’s face, some kind of caustic medicine
title: Metamorphosis

text: splashed all over him; now, without delaying any longer, Grete took
title: Metamorphosis

text: hold of all the bottles she could and ran with them in to her mother;
title: Metamorphosis

text: she slammed the door shut with her foot. So now Gregor was shut out
title: Metamorphosis

text: from his mother, who, because of him, might be near to death; he could
title: Metamorphosis

text: not open the door if he did not want to chase his sister away, and she
title: Metamorphosis

text: had to stay with his mother; there was nothing for him to do but wait;
title: Metamorphosis

text: and, oppressed with anxiety and self-reproach, he began to crawl about,
title: Metamorphosis

text: he crawled over everything, walls, furniture, ceiling, and finally in
title: Metamorphosis

text: his confusion as the whole room began to spin around him he fell down
title: Metamorphosis

text: into the middle of the dinner table.
title: Metamorphosis

text: He lay there for a while, numb and immobile, all around him it was
title: Metamorphosis

text: quiet, maybe that was a good sign. Then there was someone at the door.
title: Metamorphosis

text: The maid, of course, had locked herself in her kitchen so that Grete
title: Metamorphosis

text: would have to go and answer it. His father had arrived home. “What’s
title: Metamorphosis

text: happened?” were his first words; Grete’s appearance must have made
title: Metamorphosis

text: everything clear to him. She answered him with subdued voice, and
title: Metamorphosis

text: openly pressed her face into his chest: “Mother’s fainted, but she’s
title: Metamorphosis

text: better now. Gregor got out.” “Just as I expected”, said his father,
title: Metamorphosis

text: “just as I always said, but you women wouldn’t listen, would you.” It
title: Metamorphosis

text: was clear to Gregor that Grete had not said enough and that his father
title: Metamorphosis

text: took it to mean that something bad had happened, that he was
title: Metamorphosis

text: responsible for some act of violence. That meant Gregor would now have
title: Metamorphosis

text: to try to calm his father, as he did not have the time to explain
title: Metamorphosis

text: things to him even if that had been possible. So he fled to the door of
title: Metamorphosis

text: his room and pressed himself against it so that his father, when he
title: Metamorphosis

text: came in from the hall, could see straight away that Gregor had the best
title: Metamorphosis

text: intentions and would go back into his room without delay, that it would
title: Metamorphosis

text: not be necessary to drive him back but that they had only to open the
title: Metamorphosis

text: door and he would disappear.
title: Metamorphosis

text: His father, though, was not in the mood to notice subtleties like that;
title: Metamorphosis

text: “Ah!”, he shouted as he came in, sounding as if he were both angry and
title: Metamorphosis

text: glad at the same time. Gregor drew his head back from the door and
title: Metamorphosis

text: lifted it towards his father. He really had not imagined his father the
title: Metamorphosis

text: way he stood there now; of late, with his new habit of crawling about,
title: Metamorphosis

text: he had neglected to pay attention to what was going on the rest of the
title: Metamorphosis

text: flat the way he had done before. He really ought to have expected
title: Metamorphosis

text: things to have changed, but still, still, was that really his father?
title: Metamorphosis

text: The same tired man as used to be laying there entombed in his bed when
title: Metamorphosis

text: Gregor came back from his business trips, who would receive him sitting
title: Metamorphosis

text: in the armchair in his nightgown when he came back in the evenings; who
title: Metamorphosis

text: was hardly even able to stand up but, as a sign of his pleasure, would
title: Metamorphosis

text: just raise his arms and who, on the couple of times a year when they
title: Metamorphosis

text: went for a walk together on a Sunday or public holiday wrapped up
title: Metamorphosis

text: tightly in his overcoat between Gregor and his mother, would always
title: Metamorphosis

text: labour his way forward a little more slowly than them, who were already
title: Metamorphosis

text: walking slowly for his sake; who would place his stick down carefully
title: Metamorphosis

text: and, if he wanted to say something would invariably stop and gather his
title: Metamorphosis

text: companions around him. He was standing up straight enough now; dressed
title: Metamorphosis

text: in a smart blue uniform with gold buttons, the sort worn by the
title: Metamorphosis

text: employees at the banking institute; above the high, stiff collar of the
title: Metamorphosis

text: coat his strong double-chin emerged; under the bushy eyebrows, his
title: Metamorphosis

text: piercing, dark eyes looked out fresh and alert; his normally unkempt
title: Metamorphosis

text: white hair was combed down painfully close to his scalp. He took his
title: Metamorphosis

text: cap, with its gold monogram from, probably, some bank, and threw it in
title: Metamorphosis

text: an arc right across the room onto the sofa, put his hands in his
title: Metamorphosis

text: trouser pockets, pushing back the bottom of his long uniform coat, and,
title: Metamorphosis

text: with look of determination, walked towards Gregor. He probably did not
title: Metamorphosis

text: even know himself what he had in mind, but nonetheless lifted his feet
title: Metamorphosis

text: unusually high. Gregor was amazed at the enormous size of the soles of
title: Metamorphosis

text: his boots, but wasted no time with that—he knew full well, right from
title: Metamorphosis

text: the first day of his new life, that his father thought it necessary to
title: Metamorphosis

text: always be extremely strict with him. And so he ran up to his father,
title: Metamorphosis

text: stopped when his father stopped, scurried forwards again when he moved,
title: Metamorphosis

text: even slightly. In this way they went round the room several times
title: Metamorphosis

text: without anything decisive happening, without even giving the impression
title: Metamorphosis

text: of a chase as everything went so slowly. Gregor remained all this time
title: Metamorphosis

text: on the floor, largely because he feared his father might see it as
title: Metamorphosis

text: especially provoking if he fled onto the wall or ceiling. Whatever he
title: Metamorphosis

text: did, Gregor had to admit that he certainly would not be able to keep up
title: Metamorphosis

text: this running about for long, as for each step his father took he had to
title: Metamorphosis

text: carry out countless movements. He became noticeably short of breath,
title: Metamorphosis

text: even in his earlier life his lungs had not been very reliable. Now, as
title: Metamorphosis

text: he lurched about in his efforts to muster all the strength he could for
title: Metamorphosis

text: running he could hardly keep his eyes open; his thoughts became too
title: Metamorphosis

text: slow for him to think of any other way of saving himself than running;
title: Metamorphosis

text: he almost forgot that the walls were there for him to use although,
title: Metamorphosis

text: here, they were concealed behind carefully carved furniture full of
title: Metamorphosis

text: notches and protrusions—then, right beside him, lightly tossed,
title: Metamorphosis

text: something flew down and rolled in front of him. It was an apple; then
title: Metamorphosis

text: another one immediately flew at him; Gregor froze in shock; there was
title: Metamorphosis

text: no longer any point in running as his father had decided to bombard
title: Metamorphosis

text: him. He had filled his pockets with fruit from the bowl on the
title: Metamorphosis

text: sideboard and now, without even taking the time for careful aim, threw
title: Metamorphosis

text: one apple after another. These little, red apples rolled about on the
title: Metamorphosis

text: floor, knocking into each other as if they had electric motors. An
title: Metamorphosis

text: apple thrown without much force glanced against Gregor’s back and slid
title: Metamorphosis

text: off without doing any harm. Another one however, immediately following
title: Metamorphosis

text: it, hit squarely and lodged in his back; Gregor wanted to drag himself
title: Metamorphosis

text: away, as if he could remove the surprising, the incredible pain by
title: Metamorphosis

text: changing his position; but he felt as if nailed to the spot and spread
title: Metamorphosis

text: himself out, all his senses in confusion. The last thing he saw was the
title: Metamorphosis

text: door of his room being pulled open, his sister was screaming, his
title: Metamorphosis

text: mother ran out in front of her in her blouse (as his sister had taken
title: Metamorphosis

text: off some of her clothes after she had fainted to make it easier for her
title: Metamorphosis

text: to breathe), she ran to his father, her skirts unfastened and sliding
title: Metamorphosis

text: one after another to the ground, stumbling over the skirts she pushed
title: Metamorphosis

text: herself to his father, her arms around him, uniting herself with him
title: Metamorphosis

text: totally—now Gregor lost his ability to see anything—her hands behind
title: Metamorphosis

text: his father’s head begging him to spare Gregor’s life.
title: Metamorphosis

text: III
title: Metamorphosis

text: No-one dared to remove the apple lodged in Gregor’s flesh, so it
title: Metamorphosis

text: remained there as a visible reminder of his injury. He had suffered it
title: Metamorphosis

text: there for more than a month, and his condition seemed serious enough to
title: Metamorphosis

text: remind even his father that Gregor, despite his current sad and
title: Metamorphosis

text: revolting form, was a family member who could not be treated as an
title: Metamorphosis

text: enemy. On the contrary, as a family there was a duty to swallow any
title: Metamorphosis

text: revulsion for him and to be patient, just to be patient.
title: Metamorphosis

text: Because of his injuries, Gregor had lost much of his mobility—probably
title: Metamorphosis

text: permanently. He had been reduced to the condition of an ancient invalid
title: Metamorphosis

text: and it took him long, long minutes to crawl across his room—crawling
title: Metamorphosis

text: over the ceiling was out of the question—but this deterioration in his
title: Metamorphosis

text: condition was fully (in his opinion) made up for by the door to the
title: Metamorphosis

text: living room being left open every evening. He got into the habit of
title: Metamorphosis

text: closely watching it for one or two hours before it was opened and then,

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

text: father to wake him and try to persuade him to go to bed, as he couldn’t
title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

text: of that there was no question.

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

text: obviously wants to take over the whole flat and force us to sleep on
title: Metamorphosis

text: the streets. Father, look, just look”, she suddenly screamed, “he’s

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

text: But Gregor had had no intention of frightening anyone, least of all his

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

text: round. They seemed to have realised his good intention and had only
title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

text: His mother lay in her chair with her legs stretched out and pressed
title: Metamorphosis

text: against each other, her eyes nearly closed with exhaustion; his sister
title: Metamorphosis

text: sat next to his father with her arms around his neck.

text: “Maybe now they’ll let me turn round”, thought Gregor and went back to
title: Metamorphosis

text: work. He could not help panting loudly with the effort and had
title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

text: everything was left up to him. As soon as he had finally finished

title: Metamorphosis

text: great distance that separated him from his room, and could not
title: Metamorphosis

text: understand how he had covered that distance in his weak state a little
title: Metamorphosis

text: while before and almost without noticing it. He concentrated on
title: Metamorphosis

text: crawling as fast as he could and hardly noticed that there was not a
title: Metamorphosis

text: word, not any cry, from his family to distract him. He did not turn his

text: to see that nothing behind him had changed, only his sister had stood
title: Metamorphosis

text: up. With his last glance he saw that his mother had now fallen
title: Metamorphosis

text: completely asleep.
title: Metamorphosis

text: He was hardly inside his room before the door was hurriedly shut,
title: Metamorphosis

text: bolted and locked. The sudden noise behind Gregor so startled him that
title: Metamorphosis

text: his little legs collapsed under him. It was his sister who had been in
title: Metamorphosis

text: so much of a rush. She had been standing there waiting and sprung
title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

text: turned the key in the lock she said loudly to her parents “At last!”.

title: Metamorphosis

text: darkness. He soon made the discovery that he could no longer move at
title: Metamorphosis

text: all. This was no surprise to him, it seemed rather that being able to
title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

text: unnatural. He also felt relatively comfortable. It is true that his
title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

text: and weaker and would finally disappear altogether. He could already
title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

text: it, which was entirely covered in white dust. He thought back of his
title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

text: nostrils.

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

text: where Grete had been sleeping since the three gentlemen had moved in;
title: Metamorphosis

text: she was fully dressed as if she had never been asleep, and the paleness

title: Metamorphosis

text: another shove with the broom, sending it sideways across the floor.

title: Metamorphosis

text: did not complete it. “Now then”, said Mr. Samsa, “let’s give thanks to
title: Metamorphosis

text: God for that”. He crossed himself, and the three women followed his
title: Metamorphosis

text: example. Grete, who had not taken her eyes from the corpse, said: “Just
title: Metamorphosis

text: look how thin he was. He didn’t eat anything for so long. The food came
title: Metamorphosis

text: out again just the same as when it went in”. Gregor’s body was indeed
title: Metamorphosis

text: completely dried up and flat, they had not seen it until then, but now
title: Metamorphosis

text: he was not lifted up on his little legs, nor did he do anything to make
title: Metamorphosis

text: them look away.
title: Metamorphosis

text: “Grete, come with us in here for a little while”, said Mrs. Samsa with
title: Metamorphosis

text: a pained smile, and Grete followed her parents into the bedroom but not
title: Metamorphosis

text: without looking back at the body. The cleaner shut the door and opened
title: Metamorphosis

text: the window wide. Although it was still early in the morning the fresh
title: Metamorphosis

text: air had something of warmth mixed in with it. It was already the end of
title: Metamorphosis

text: March, after all.
title: Metamorphosis

text: The three gentlemen stepped out of their room and looked round in
title: Metamorphosis

text: amazement for their breakfasts; they had been forgotten about. “Where
title: Metamorphosis

text: is our breakfast?”, the middle gentleman asked the cleaner irritably.
title: Metamorphosis

text: She just put her finger on her lips and made a quick and silent sign to
title: Metamorphosis

text: the men that they might like to come into Gregor’s room. They did so,
title: Metamorphosis

text: and stood around Gregor’s corpse with their hands in the pockets of
title: Metamorphosis

text: their well-worn coats. It was now quite light in the room.
title: Metamorphosis

text: Then the door of the bedroom opened and Mr. Samsa appeared in his
title: Metamorphosis

text: uniform with his wife on one arm and his daughter on the other. All of
title: Metamorphosis

text: them had been crying a little; Grete now and then pressed her face
title: Metamorphosis

text: against her father’s arm.
title: Metamorphosis

text: “Leave my home. Now!”, said Mr. Samsa, indicating the door and without
title: Metamorphosis

text: letting the women from him. “What do you mean?”, asked the middle of
title: Metamorphosis

text: the three gentlemen somewhat disconcerted, and he smiled sweetly. The
title: Metamorphosis

text: other two held their hands behind their backs and continually rubbed
title: Metamorphosis

text: them together in gleeful anticipation of a loud quarrel which could
title: Metamorphosis

text: only end in their favour. “I mean just what I said”, answered Mr.
title: Metamorphosis

text: Samsa, and, with his two companions, went in a straight line towards
title: Metamorphosis

text: the man. At first, he stood there still, looking at the ground as if
title: Metamorphosis

text: the contents of his head were rearranging themselves into new
title: Metamorphosis

text: positions. “Alright, we’ll go then”, he said, and looked up at Mr.
title: Metamorphosis

text: Samsa as if he had been suddenly overcome with humility and wanted

text: permission again from Mr. Samsa for his decision. Mr. Samsa merely
title: Metamorphosis

text: opened his eyes wide and briefly nodded to him several times. At that,
title: Metamorphosis

text: and without delay, the man actually did take long strides into the
title: Metamorphosis

text: front hallway; his two friends had stopped rubbing their hands some
title: Metamorphosis

text: time before and had been listening to what was being said. Now they
title: Metamorphosis

text: jumped off after their friend as if taken with a sudden fear that Mr.
title: Metamorphosis

text: Samsa might go into the hallway in front of them and break the
title: Metamorphosis

text: connection with their leader. Once there, all three took their hats
title: Metamorphosis

text: from the stand, took their sticks from the holder, bowed without a word

text: and left the premises. Mr. Samsa and the two women followed them out
title: Metamorphosis

text: onto the landing; but they had had no reason to mistrust the men’s
title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

text: gentlemen made slow but steady progress down the many steps. As they
title: Metamorphosis

text: turned the corner on each floor they disappeared and would reappear a
title: Metamorphosis

text: few moments later; the further down they went, the more that the Samsa
title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

text: They decided the best way to make use of that day was for relaxation

text: and to go for a walk; not only had they earned a break from work but
title: Metamorphosis

text: they were in serious need of it. So they sat at the table and wrote
title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

text: contractor and Grete to her principal. The cleaner came in while they
title: Metamorphosis

text: were writing to tell them she was going, she’d finished her work for
title: Metamorphosis

text: that morning. The three of them at first just nodded without looking up
title: Metamorphosis

text: from what they were writing, and it was only when the cleaner still did
title: Metamorphosis

text: not seem to want to leave that they looked up in irritation. “Well?”,
title: Metamorphosis

text: asked Mr. Samsa. The charwoman stood in the doorway with a smile on her
title: Metamorphosis

text: face as if she had some tremendous good news to report, but would only
title: Metamorphosis

text: do it if she was clearly asked to. The almost vertical little ostrich
title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

text: all the time she had been working for them, swayed gently in all
title: Metamorphosis

text: directions. “What is it you want then?”, asked Mrs. Samsa, whom the
title: Metamorphosis

text: cleaner had the most respect for. “Yes”, she answered, and broke into a
title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

text: that thing in there, you needn’t worry about how you’re going to get

text: rid of it. That’s all been sorted out.” Mrs. Samsa and Grete bent down

text: over their letters as if intent on continuing with what they were
title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

text: from either his wife or his daughter as the charwoman seemed to have
title: Metamorphosis

text: destroyed the peace they had only just gained. They got up and went

title: Metamorphosis

text: other. Mr. Samsa twisted round in his chair to look at them and sat

title: Metamorphosis

text: forget about all that old stuff, shall we. Come and give me a bit of
title: Metamorphosis

text: attention”. The two women immediately did as he said, hurrying over to
title: Metamorphosis

text: him where they kissed him and hugged him and then they quickly finished
title: Metamorphosis

text: their letters.
title: Metamorphosis

text: After that, the three of them left the flat together, which was
title: Metamorphosis

text: something they had not done for months, and took the tram out to the
title: Metamorphosis

text: open country outside the town. They had the tram, filled with warm
title: Metamorphosis

text: sunshine, all to themselves. Leant back comfortably on their seats,
title: Metamorphosis

text: they discussed their prospects and found that on closer examination
title: Metamorphosis

text: they were not at all bad—until then they had never asked each other
title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

text: particularly good promise for the future. The greatest improvement for
title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis

title: Metamorphosis
